definition: to make an appearance in court
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: The first basic issue of the compulsory attendance' measures in criminal investigation is its concept.
sentences.chinese: 强制到案措施这个概念，在我国侦查实践中十分陌生。

sentences.english: Hard labor for life had been the sentence pronounced against the escaped and contumacious accomplices.
sentences.chinese: 在逃没有到案的同谋则被判处终身苦役。

definition: to bring to justice/to file away (a document)
to surrender to the authorities/to turn oneself in (for a crime)
to make a full confession/to plead guilty
(of a bird, fish etc) to be caught in a net/(of a tennis ball) to hit the net/(of a criminal) to be captured
to give oneself up/to surrender (to the authorities)
to be at large (of a criminal)
